html:
5.11.19  12:12 pm   5.10.19  8:02 pm - Okay then, let me show you these words which will convey the virtues of albums. Me personally, I view albums as more like a book or a short story, where each track is a particularly memorable sentence from a chapter that sticks in your head, or a plot twist/intriguing moment or something like that. The whole purpose of an album in my opinion is to create a story that's bigger than just one song could provide, or rather tell one story but with a lot of nuance and detail to it. Instead of taking them on a short journey with one song and trying to pack as much as you can in there, with an album you can give yourself time to think and breathe and tell as much as needs telling and in the time it takes, y'know? Not tryna invalidate your approach to "musical storytelling", but that's the angle I tackle the music-making bull from, anyway.


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201905102002

html:
5.2.19  5:51 pm   4.30.19  10:27 am It's like how you have several parts of your brain (limbic system, frontal lobe, occipital lobe, etc.) and even if some of them act independently of the others, "you" are still "aware of" what they do (create emotion, make judgements, process vision, respectively). And, in the case of, say, the occipital lobe, even if the neurons never receive signals from each other directly, the lobe is still "aware" of what the neurons do (aware meaning affecting behavior. In this case, what the neurons do determines how the lobe behaves, i.e. what it communicates to the other parts of the brain, and so we say the lobe is "aware of" the neurons' actions. Same applies for part of your brain affecting "you").
The ABC scenario is a just simple example of this Russian-nesting-doll of consciousness, where higher levels are aware of the thoughts of lower levels, but not vice-versa. My theory is that, just as a human has independent parts yet feels like a single experiencing mind and not like millions of tiny neuron minds, so too may there be a higher level of consciousness that feels like me and only me, you and only you, Benedict Cumberbatch and only Cumberbatch, … , and perhaps some non-person thoughts exclusive to the higher-level-consciousness.
That's what I mean by everyone is everyone else. By the theory, we are all just one entity that experiences many localized, I-am-me-and-noone-else perspectives. Of course I feel like me, and you feel like you. But that feeling of individual identity does not mean that our experiences are not just the thoughts of one single entity.


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201904301027

4.30.19  10:27 am   I have a theory that everyone is everyone else. Like, you have person A and B, and A thinks it's A and not B, and B thinks it's B and not A. But A and B are in the brain of person C (or you can think of it like C is reading the minds of both A and B). So C has the experience of thinking it's A and not B, and thinking it's B and not A, and maybe independent C thoughts not in A or B.
Maybe people are like A and B, but we're all just C. Helps to explain why I feel like me and not like someone else. Any constructive criticism on this theory?

     the thesis (first sentence) seemed strong, but the explanation didn't seem clear to me. C reads minds? ? the explanation seemed to demonstrate that some people read minds and others do not . ... which doesn't seem to connect to the original statement .....

4.25.19  11:09 am   4.23.19  9:55 pm how can i develop such a bold level of confidence in a "product"?

4.23.19  9:55 pm   How do you handle the notion of consumer expectation when doing something as personal as music? Or do you not handle it?

     i was able to spend an obscene amount of time developing the product outside the realm of any consumer on earth. i was so confident in where i was going that i knew it would be the right product, especially for the right consumer(s). then when the consumer(s) arrived i was already well accustomed to the strategy and there was certainly no need to change it. but i do find that i need some shades or blinds occasionally, just so i can see what i'm doing a little more clearly

html:
4.21.19  10:39 pm   4.21.19  1:25 am what do you mean by improvising the lyrics?

      For your own songs? Other songs? Any songs?

      And what do you find beneficial about this?


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201904210125

4.21.19  1:25 am   let's say that i desperately wanna make my own music, just as you are, but i have absolutely no experience in making my voice sound remotely good. i've got good ears and pitch and everything, but the voice just sounds bad and the technique is nonexistent. how do you think i could at least get my voice to a good baseline which i could expand on throughout my life, in like a solid two months?
i know "just do it a lot" is a great answer here, but how do i "just do it" well enough that i can make solid progress along with that? i think i know how this works for physical instruments which i can observe the mechanics of in front of my eyes, but the voice is too obscure, where should i even start? i can feel myself dipping into that 13th level of suffering

     this is similar to what i went through, because i am working from the same starting point as you. but you will already be better after 1 month. and at 2 months you will be a little better. and at 3 months you will be better. so the 'baseline' you are working with is actually right now, that's your starting point. 2 months from now will be the middle. unless you stop singing entirely after 2 months.
     for specifics on technique, for some reason no professional vocal technical advice ever made any sense to me until many years later, and much of it still doesn't. i found that the voice is so deeply connected with life itself that it was almost impossible for me to think directly about most of the things professionals tell you to think about. so i had to find much more abstract tricks. one of the most important tricks i learned was to improvise the lyrics. and for scripted material, try to do it like you are terrified of joe jackson whipping you
original_html:

html:
4.15.19  5:24 am   4.13.19  9:55 pm    That was a very cool happy birthday harmonisation but it may be lost on the person who asked, that happy birthday in C, the first note is G, since they are asking a fairly basic question


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201904132155

4.13.19  9:55 pm   What are some cool ways to harmonize a melody?

     on 'old macdonald had a farm', let's say it's in C, you could add "f f e" notes above "had a farm" (a sixth up, in the key). Also on "happy birthday", on the last line ('happy birthday to you'), again let's say it's in C, you could put these notes under the melody: happy(Ab), birth(G), day(F#), to(F), you(E)
original_html: 4.15.19  5:24 am   4.13.19  9:55 pm    That was a very cool happy birthday harmonisation but it may be lost on the person who asked, that happy birthday in C, the first note is G, since they are asking a fairly basic question

html:
3.31.19  3:46 pm   3.30.16  2:12 pm What "project" was this question referring to?


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201603301412

3.30.16  2:12 pm   could you tell me why you're not revealing what your current project in a way that doesn't reveal the current project, or is that impossible?

     i am nervous about whether anyone will care about this project. the true fans will probably love it, but if i were to advertise this project as the Next Big Thing, Available at Book Stores and Museums Across the Country, Bring Your Kids if you are Looking For Something Neat To Do, people might be extremely confused and disappointed when they see what it actually is i've been working on. however, i think the true fans will love it and they have probably been waiting for this for a while. the release of this project will be totally stealth, kind of like my website was when it first came out.
     i am anxious to finish this thing, because the project After that, IS something that i would want to be "sent to stores" so to speak
original_html: 3.31.19  3:46 pm   3.30.16  2:12 pm What "project" was this question referring to?

answers_original.html:
3.30.16  2:12 pm   could you tell me why you're not revealing what your current project in a way that doesn't reveal the current project, or is that impossible?

     i am nervous about whether anyone will care about this project. the true fans will probably love it, but if i were to advertise this project as the Next Big Thing, Available at Book Stores and Museums Across the Country, Bring Your Kids if you are Looking For Something Neat To Do, people might be extremely confused and disappointed when they see what it actually is i've been working on. however, i think the true fans will love it and they have probably been waiting for this for a while. the release of this project will be totally stealth, kind of like my website was when it first came out.
     i am anxious to finish this thing, because the project After that, IS something that i would want to be "sent to stores" so to speak

html:
3.30.19  2:23 am   3.29.19  3:26 pm well, I know so little about established music theory, that im not even sure what it is, how many theories of music there are.

      Maybe it works exactly like how i think about music, maybe it's entirely different. I feel like the moment I try to learn it, though, it might start to influence the ideas i already have, which isnt necessarily bad but a part of me feels like i should keep it isolated for maximum interesting outcome. i think i'll write a book about it and make millions revolutionizing the music industry with information that might already be well established.


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201903291526

3.29.19  3:26 pm   I don't know much of anything about music theory. But I can compose tunes pretty easily, and I can very intuitively tell when some series of notes are good, or when some are bad. I've come up with this idea of composition that models songs/melodies based on the attention they gather from the listener (attention being used, for lack of better word), which seems like a promising way of writing/thinking about songs. A part of me wants to ignore modern music theory and reinvent the wheel as a means of making more unique music, another part of me says that maybe that's a bad idea. These parts of me are getting very upset, and they're calling each other VERY rude names. Can you help settle the dispute?

     your theory sounds great. you weren't even too clear about what that other competing theory even is, so from here it seems like a no brainer
original_html:
3.30.19  2:23 am   3.29.19  3:26 pm well, I know so little about established music theory, that im not even sure what it is, how many theories of music there are.

      Maybe it works exactly like how i think about music, maybe it's entirely different. I feel like the moment I try to learn it, though, it might start to influence the ideas i already have, which isnt necessarily bad but a part of me feels like i should keep it isolated for maximum interesting outcome. i think i'll write a book about it and make millions revolutionizing the music industry with information that might already be well established.

answers_original.html:
3.29.19  3:26 pm   I don't know much of anything about music theory. But I can compose tunes pretty easily, and I can very intuitively tell when some series of notes are good, or when some are bad. I've come up with this idea of composition that models songs/melodies based on the attention they gather from the listener (attention being used, for lack of better word), which seems like a promising way of writing/thinking about songs. A part of me wants to ignore modern music theory and reinvent the wheel as a means of making more unique music, another part of me says that maybe that's a bad idea. These parts of me are getting very upset, and they're calling each other VERY rude names. Can you help settle the dispute?

     your theory sounds great. you weren't even too clear about what that other competing theory even is, so from here it seems like a no brainer
